page.title: 01Landscape Bilbrough
page.content:
This is a general description of Bilbrough in 1985.
The village is about 150 feet above sea level on the Ainsty ridge, and commands a view of the south western side of the Vale of York as far as the 4 great power stations.It is a small village surrounded by farmland and patches of woodland. In 1983 there were 265 people living in the parish.There are 85 houses and 3 farms,a church,a pub, and a school. Bilbrough has a village hall.It has no shop nor post office,but food vans bring fish, groceries and bread.Milk and papers are delivered daily.A library van calls every fortnight on Monday.Buses run through the village twice a day.Main Street is the oldest part of the village.Houses date from the 17th century.
